official-title.#text:

text.#text:
All necessary regulations to implement this
				paragraph shall be promulgated by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the
and the
, shall consider all factors that the

deems relevant, including electronic travel authorizations,
				procedures for reporting lost and stolen passports, repatriation of aliens,
				rates of refusal for nonimmigrant visitor visas, overstays, exit systems, and
				information exchange.

text.#text:
In determining whether to grant or continue
				providing the waiver under this paragraph to nationals of any country, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall monitor the admission of nonimmigrant
				visitors to the United States Virgin Islands under this paragraph. If the

determines that such admissions have resulted in an unacceptable
				number of visitors from a country remaining unlawfully in the United States
				Virgin Islands, unlawfully obtaining entry to other parts of the United States,
				or seeking withholding of removal or asylum, or that visitors from a country
				pose a risk to law enforcement or security interests of the United States
				Virgin Islands or of the United States (including the interest in the
				enforcement of the immigration laws of the United States), the

shall
				suspend the admission of nationals of such country under this paragraph. The

may in the Secretary's discretion suspend the
				United States Virgin Islands visa waiver program at any time, on a
				country-by-country basis, for other good cause.
